review_title: Organization is ok, but some departments are very toxic
pros:
- A lot of flexibility with work hours (30 hour work week, flex hours, short Fridays in the summer)
- Great location (when work was in office)
- Colleagues are great and supportive
- Culture and transparency seems to be improving since the change in CEO
- Work-life balance (though this varies widely between departments)
cons:
- Used to have more internal opportunities, it seems that most new opportunities are contract or they're looking for external hires
- Some departments are extremely toxic:
-- for example, I had received an email as a "reminder" that I'm not allowed to take breaks during work hours, and if I did, I would have to make up the time
-- some managers are micromanagers: would ask staff to sign in/out during the morning, lunch, and evening; ask to be cc'd on many emails; not allowed to respond to emails from other departments without permission from manager
- Department had high turnover, but roles were not backfilled

Would strongly recommend asking about the department's turnover rate before accepting an offer

pros:
- forward-thinking company that cares about its employees
- great work/life balance
- very competitive salary and benefits/vacation
- 35 hour work week
- early departure on long weekends and every Friday during the summer
- ability to be involved in many committees and working groups in the College
- great staff events
- recognition for hard work 
- flex work hours (no core hours)
- opportunity for some to work from home
- managers/supervisors support training and educational opportunities for your career growth
- open communication and interaction between all staff, regardless of title
- a lot of opportunities for advancement within the College - typically hire from within first before looking for outside candidates
- upper management staff always looking into ways to improve College processes and asks all staff for input
- get to be a part of an organization that protects the public
- incredibly supportive HR staff
- fantastic culture at the College. Most staff are friendly and more than happy  assist one another
cons: - work from home option not available for all positions (College is working to become completely digital in the near future so this will not be an issue eventually)

review_title: Competitive salary, good people, interesting work
pros:
-Fair compensation and benefits; pension
- Interesting work; progressive thinking
- Proximity to TTC
- Nice colleagues;  very respectful; people care about each other 
- Opportunity for growth and advancement for those willing to work hard and put in their time. 
- I am shocked to read other reviews that portray this as a terrible workplace with poor management.  I have been employed here for several years and I think it's a great place to work.  In my experience, employees who don't last here are very negative and/or don't want to work hard for promotions/raises.
cons:
- Some politics, but likely no more than any other workplace. 
- Outdated technology.  Paper based processes. (But they are working on it).
- Hierarchy culture.
